title: Short-Term Rental (Airbnb/VRBO) Regulations
summary: Cincinnati requires registration for all short-term rentals. Rules vary based on owner occupancy and building type.

definitions.short_term_rental: Rental of a dwelling unit for less than 30 consecutive days
definitions.operator: Person who operates or is responsible for the short-term rental
definitions.hosting_platform: Website or app used to list/book short-term rentals (Airbnb, VRBO, etc.)

documents_required: Proof of ownership or written landlord consent
Lead-based paint disclosure (for buildings built before 1978)

owner_occupied.description: Owner or long-term tenant must live on-site
owner_occupied.exemptions: Units in historic districts may have additional limits

non_owner_occupied.cap: City-wide cap may apply based on neighborhood

prohibited_zones: Units in buildings with open code violations
Units without proper fire safety equipment

operational_requirements.parking: Must not create parking issues for neighbors
operational_requirements.trash: Operator responsible for proper waste disposal
operational_requirements.signage: No external advertising signs allowed on residential property
operational_requirements.contact_info: Must provide 24/7 contact number to city and neighbors

violations.revocation: 3 violations in 12 months may result in registration revocation

inspection.frequency: Before initial registration and upon complaint
inspection.scope: Fire safety, occupancy limits, building code compliance
